newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish April trade surplus seen up, c/a in black.
newsitem.headline: Danish April trade surplus seen up, c/a in black.

text.p: Denmark's foreign trade surplus for April is expected to increase with the current account swinging back into the black, according to a Reuter poll of nine bank analysts issued on Monday.

The analysts forecast that the seasonally adjusted foreign trade surplus for April excluding ships, would rise to an average 2.9 billion crowns from March's 2.2 billion crown surplus, with estimates ranging from 2.6-3.5 billion crowns.
"The main reason for the foreign trade surplus is the ongoing rise in agricultural and industrial exports," Sydbank analysts said in a comment.
The panel also foresaw the April current account swinging back into an average 1.0 billion crown surplus from March's 1.3 billion crown deficit, with estimates within a 0.2-2.0 billion crown margin.
The Danish national statistics office is due to issue its April foreign trade and current account data on Wednesday July 9 at 0730 GMT.
